Class SelectionScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • SelectionScreen

  • public class SelectionScreen
extends java.lang.Object
    This class builds a SelectionScreen from which a user can pick a particular Graph to be displayed. Modelled to be executed after the StartScreen class which introduces the user to the GraphVisualizer program. Uses a GameArena class to create a window on which objects will be displayed. Text class is used as well to display any textual information.
    See Also:
    StartScreen, Text, GameArena, Graph, Graph1, Graph2, Graph3, Graph4, Graph5

    • Constructor Detail

      • SelectionScreen

        public SelectionScreen()
        Constructor. Takes no parameters, waits for the showSelectScreen() method to be invoked.

    • Method Detail

      • showSelectScreen

        public void showSelectScreen()
        Method creating a SelectionScreen from which a user can navigate to different Graphs. Creates instances of particular Graphs when an appropriate button (Rectangle) is clicked.

      • getState

        public boolean getState()
        Method that obtains a state of this SelectionScreen.
        Returns:
        true when SelectionScreen is active, false when is closed.

      • addObjects

        public void addObjects(GameArena arena)
        Adds all the components which act as Menu to the specified GameArena.
        Parameters:
        arena - Arena to which navigation components are to be added.

      • closeSelection

        public void closeSelection()
        Used to close this SelectionScreen upon termination of the application or displaying a particular Graph.

      • getArena

        public GameArena getArena()
        Obtains the GameArena that this SelectionScreen uses to display menu components.
        Returns:
        arena_object

      • closeApp

        public void closeApp(boolean state)
        Fetching the state of this SelectionScreen to determine whether the termination of the whole application should be performed.
        Parameters:
        state - State of the SelectionScreen, true for active, false for termination.
